title: French President Macron urges Europe to start acting like world power
byline: French President Emmanuel Macron has urged Europe to assert itself on the world stage, saying it is time to start acting like a “power”.

title: Zonal Education Director and Teacher Instructor arrested by Bribery Commission
byline: A Zonal Director of Education and a Teacher Instructor attached to the Dehiattakandiya Zonal Education Office have been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption.

title: Discussions held to streamline domestic civil air operations
byline: The Secretary to the Ministry of Defence, Air Vice Marshal Sampath Thuyacontha (Retd), chaired a stakeholder meeting at the Ministry of Defence, to discuss matters affecting the domestic airline operations.

title: Prevailing dry weather conditions expected to change from tomorrow
byline: The prevailing dry weather conditions are expected to change from tomorrow (12).

title: President Anura Kumara to visit Nuwara Eliya today to inaugurate several programmes
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to visit Nuwara Eliya today (11) to inaugurate the Central Province programme of the “A Nation United” national campaign.

title: Verdict on ex-MP Amarakeerthi Athukorala’s murder case to be delivered today
byline: The verdict in the case pertaining to the murder of former Member of Parliament Amarakeerthi Athukorala is scheduled to be delivered today.

title: Trinco Buddha statue incident: Balangoda Kassapa Thero and others to be produced in court
byline: Four Buddhist monks, including Ven. Balangoda Kassapa Thero, and six other individuals, who were arrested and subsequently remanded are scheduled to be produced before the Trincomalee Magistrate’s Court.

title: Exposition of sacred Devnimori relics at Gangaramaya draws to a close
byline: The exposition of the sacred Devnimori relics of Lord Buddha at the Gangaramaya Temple in Hunupitiya, Colombo concluded this morning.

title: Britney Spears sells rights to entire music catalogue
byline: Pop superstar Britney Spears has sold the rights to her entire music catalogue, the BBC has learned.

title: Sri Lanka deeply honoured to host Devnimori relics, says FM as relics return to India
byline: Sri Lanka was deeply honoured to host the sacred Devnimori relics for seven days, allowing people across the country to pay homage and venerate them, Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism, Vijitha Herath has stated.

title: Colombo- Ahmedabad direct flights to commence in April
byline: Plans are underway to launch direct flights between Colombo and Ahmedabad, India.

title: 10 dead after mass shooting in British Columbia, Canada
byline: Ten people, including a suspected shooter, were found dead after a mass shooting in a town in northeastern British Columbia on Tuesday, Canadian police said.

title: Verdict in ex-MP Amarakeerthi Athukorala’s murder case to be delivered today
byline: The verdict in the case pertaining to the murder of former Member of Parliament Amarakeerthi Athukorala is scheduled to be delivered today.

title: Four suspects, including woman, arrested in attempted assassination of SJB member in Kalutara
byline: Four suspects, including a woman, have been arrested in connection with the attempted assassination of Bandula Prasanna, a Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) member who contested for the Kalutara Municipal Council during the last local government election.

title: President Anura Kumara to visit Nuwara Eliya today to inaugurate several projects
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to visit Nuwara Eliya today (11) to inaugurate the Central Province programme of the “A Nation United” national campaign.

title: India tightens grip on social media with new three-hour takedown rule
byline: India’s government said social media companies would have to take down unlawful content within three hours of being notified about it, tightening on Tuesday an earlier 36-hour timeline in what could be a compliance challenge for Meta, YouTube and X.

title: PM-EU delegation discuss ways to expand economic cooperation, trade and investment
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya and a delegation of the European External Action Service have held discussions in a bid to strengthen the long-standing partnership between Sri Lanka and the European Union.

title: Plane carrying 55 passengers crashes into Indian Ocean just moments after take-off
byline: A plane carrying 55 passengers has crashed into the Indian Ocean in a horrific incident just moments after taking off from Aden Adde International Airport.

title: Tuition classes targeting 2025 O/L exam banned from midnight
byline: The conduct of tuition classes, seminars, and other workshops targeting the 2025 GCE Ordinary Level (O/L) Examination is banned from midnight today (11) until the conclusion of the exam.

title: Balangoda Kassapa Thero and others produced before court
byline: Ten suspects, including Venerable Balangoda Kassapa Thero and other monks, who are currently in remand custody in connection with the Trincomalee Buddha statue incident, have been brought to court.

title: Stakeholder engagement on tariff reforms underway
byline: Stakeholder engagement on the proposed tariff reforms has got underway as part of the implementation of the 2026 Budget proposals aimed at supporting domestic industries, the Department of Trade and Investment Policy said in a statement.

title: President meets plantation workers in Nanu Oya, receives warm welcome
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake met with a group of plantation workers this morning (11) along the Nanu Oya–Radella road and engaged in a cordial discussion with them.

title: SJB MPs file bribery complaint against Speaker’s Private Secretary
byline: A group of Samagi Jana Balawegaya SJB MPs today lodged a complaint with the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption, alleging that the Private Secretary of the Speaker is acting in a manner that interferes with investigations into a complaint previously filed against Speaker of House Jagath Wickramaratne.

title: President to visit Nuwara Eliya today to inaugurate several projects
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to visit Nuwara Eliya today (11) to inaugurate the Central Province programme of the “A Nation United” national campaign.

title: Amarakeerthi Athukorala Murder Case: Suspects produced before court
byline: Suspects in the case filed over the assault and killing of former Member of Parliament Amarakeerthi Athukorala and his security officer have been brought before the Gampaha High Court Trial-at-Bar, according to Ada Derana reporter.

title: ‘It would have been a nuclear war’: Trump again claims he stopped India-Pakistan conflict
byline: US President Donald Trump has once again claimed that he had stopped a war between India and Pakistan last year, which he said could have escalated into a nuclear conflict, by using tariffs as leverage.

title: CBK warns decline in public service could lead to instability in Sri Lanka
byline: Former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga has warned that Sri Lanka could face further instability unless the current mode of governance is changed, underscoring the vital role of a professional and honest public service in maintaining the foundations of the State.

title: 12 sentenced to death over ex-MP Amarakeerthi Athukorala’s murder
byline: Twelve individuals have been sentenced to death in over the murder of former Polonnaruwa District Member of Parliament Amarakeerthi Athukorala in 2022.

title: UK sees sharp drop in int’l postgraduate students, enrollments from Sri Lanka down 36%
byline: New data from the UK’s Higher Education Statistics Agency (HESA) shows a major shift in international student trends.

title: Gold and silver prices increase once again
byline: Gold and silver prices rose on Wednesday as the U.S. dollar and Treasury bond yields fell after data showed December retail sales growth stalled, signalling a softening economy ahead of key jobs data later in the day.

title: Over a million devotees venerated sacred Devnimori relics in Sri Lanka
byline: The Exposition of the Holy Devnimori Relics of Lord Buddha, which were brought to Sri Lanka on February 04, concluded successfully at the Gangaramaya Temple in Colombo, with the sacred relics departing for India today (11).

title: New ADB Country Director assures continuous support for Sri Lanka during meeting with PM
byline: The newly appointed Country Director of the Asian Development Bank (ADB) for Sri Lanka, Shannon Cowlin and the ADB delegation have held discussions with the Prime Minister, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya at the Prime Minister’s Office.

title: Balangoda Kassapa Thero and others granted bail
byline: Four Buddhist monks, including Ven. Balangoda Kassapa Thero, and six other individuals, have been granted bail by the Trincomalee High Court.

title: Former Presidential Secretary Saman Ekanayake further remanded
byline: Former Secretary to the President Saman Ekanayake has been further remanded until February 18 by the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court.

title: Walk for Peace: Buddhist monks arrive in Washington after 2,300-mile journey
byline: A group of Buddhist monks — bearing a message of peace — walked into the heart of Washington, D.C., on Tuesday, greeted by large, joyful crowds as they completed their 15-week trek from Texas.

title: Sri Lanka Police strengthens safety measures amid surge in water-related incidents
byline: Sri Lanka Police says that a significant increase in water-related accidents has been observed across the country.

title: Sri Lanka and Thailand conclude negotiations on landmark labour cooperation framework
byline: The Embassy and Permanent Mission of Sri Lanka in Bangkok has successfully facilitated and participated in a series of discussions and negotiations to finalize two key bilateral instruments on labour cooperation between Sri Lanka and the Kingdom of Thailand.

title: Govt pursuing an independent foreign policy that does not favor any country – President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake says that the government is working towards an independent foreign policy without adhering to any foreign nation while protecting Sri Lanka’s stability in the present conflict-ridden world.

title: 2026 Electoral Register revision begins – Election Commission
byline: The Election Commission has commenced the data collection process for the revision of the electoral register, the Commissioner General of Elections, Rasika Peiris stated.

title: Govt to pay Rs. 1,200 mln for crop damage caused by Nilwala River salinity barrier
byline: The Agricultural and Agrarian Insurance Board has stated that necessary measures have been taken to provide compensation to farmers whose crops were damaged due to the irregular construction of the salinity barrier across the Nilwala River.

title: Gunman apprehended in southern Thailand after holding students and teachers hostage in school
byline: A hostage situation and a shooting were reported Wednesday inside a school in southern Thailand, authorities said. The situation was resolved after a few hours, with the gunman apprehended, police said.

title: Sri Lanka’s Deputy Defence Minister attends World Defense Show 2026 in Riyadh
byline: Deputy Minister of Defence, Major General (Retd) Aruna Jayasekara, has participated in the World Defense Show (WDS) 2026 in Riyadh, Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, following an official invitation.

title: Standing up for Buddhism and Maha Sangha is not racism – Namal
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) National Organizer and Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa stated that standing up for Buddhism, the Buddha Sasana, and the Maha Sangha is not racism.
